result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall Scott Klitzka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Scott Klitzka

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randall Scott Klitzka in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Randall Scott Klitzka.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Case Parties held negotiations off the record. 
Negotiations placed on the record. Upon the motion of the County. Court ordered charge amended to Carry Concealed Weapon, Sec. 63.015, County Ordinance, to which Defendant plead no contest. Defendant found guilty of amended charge. Court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $144.00 inclusive of costs, to be paid by 11/28/2022.  Failure to pay will result in civil forfeiture/tax intercept.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Randall Scott Klitzka in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Randall Scott Klitzka
Current: 3026 S. 60th Street, Apt 1E, Milwaukee, WI 53219 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 4660 S 51St St,1, Greenfield, WI 53220
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Randall Scott Klitzka not in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/11/2022@1pm
